name: The London West Hollywood

reviews.text: I stayed at the London for the second in a year. Both stays were 4 days in duration. This is one of my favourite hotels anywhere in the world. When I booked, I needed a twin room, whilst the Hotel Policy is you can't confirm this room type, I just knew the Hotel would go out of there way to enusre this happened - and it did! We turned up after a long flight from Australia - our room was ready and correct! Monique on the front desk is just so efficient!
reviews.title: Absolute Pleasure Yet Again

reviews.text: Christopher and Joseph on the concierge desk were just so helpful and all their recommendations were great. Actually all the staff are really helpful and happy!
reviews.title: Size matters!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are really big and the bathrooms are well appointed and luxurious. The hotel is spotlessly cleaned. The breakfast is great and I look forward to it each morning. It is in the perfect location - it is a short taxi drive everywhere.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I certainly look forward to my next trip to West Hollywood and the London.
reviews.title: Gorgeous sunset strip hotel with friendly staff and great rooftop pool
Good food and sophisticated dining.
reviews.text: Fantastic place to stay with girlfriends. The rooms are large by any hotel standards. We had two beds plus a roll-away and still had plenty of space. The accommodations are beautiful and I still have dreams about the light grey suede walls. The staff appears to be hand picked for their courteous ways and memory. I would not hesitate to stay here again. This is my new favorite hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the reviewer from Sydney mentioned, this hotel was exceptional in every way. For a 4* hotel this betters many of the top 5* I have ever stayed at. From the attentive and amazingly mannered staff to the beautifully designed lobby, rooms and roof, I found that at every turn it just kept getting better. Unlike Shutters which we stayed at afterwards, the internet was free, there was bountiful amounts of tiny details which showed that somebody has been thinking about the guests stay. P.s. the bathrooms were great. Full marks.
reviews.title: WOW - An all round amazing hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot rate this hotel experience highly enough.
reviews.title: Luxurious and relaxing hotel experience

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, the service was friendly, chatty, helpful, warm and inviting. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and professional.
reviews.title: Fantastic! We loved The London!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is elegantly presented with all the amenities one would expect of a hotel of this class.
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not feeling well at the back end of this trip due to catching colds on the various flights, however, The London was an experience where we didnt mind just staying around it and absorbing all it had to offer.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are worried about being the oldest or least fashionable person in the lobby, don't stay here! But if you want to experience the sophisticated side of LA rather than the tawdry touristy bits, then this hotel is good value for money. Staff are all outstandingly helpful and the rooms are large and delightfully furnished. We only stayed in LA two nights and our only minor disappointment was missing out on using the rooftop pool after returning from a warm afternoon at the Getty centre. A note slipped under our door advised the roof was closed due to a function, however compensatory complimentary drinks were on offer in the bar from 4 to 6 - we returned at 6.15! A minor complaint - just that if we had known earlier in the day we would have planned our swim for much earlier, or made it back for happy hour!
reviews.title: Ultra cool, beautiful eclectic interior design and fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first night of our honeymoon and we stayed for 3 nights. Ideal location right by Sunset Boulevard - we rented a car and found it really easy to get around. The hotel had a great rooftop pool and patio and we had dinner one evening in Gordon Ramsay's restaurant which was delicious.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The concierge was very helpful (was amused that he was an aspiring actor and the bar man had his own band - so Hollywood) and the staff helpful and courteous. A perfect start to our romantic getaway with a fruit bowl and sparkling wine brought to our room when we arrived.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time and love it. Will go back. Lots of value in your room rate. Great healthclub, views and pool. Give it a try!
reviews.title: If you choose this hotel you will not be sorry!

reviews.text: Perfect, quite location with a panoramic view of downtown LA. The room is very large with a large veranda and very comfortable. There is a small area to make your own coffee and tea with a bar fridge.
reviews.title: Luxury in West Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honestly, I have to dig remarkably deep to find one flaw with this phenomenal hotel. Service, rooms and location are perfect.
reviews.title: Best hotel in LA...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the gym is poor and prices have been going up (as I suspect everyone realizes what I have). Top choice in LA.
reviews.title: Fab hotel!

reviews.text: We decided to stay at The London because of the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: An Oasis in a very busy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every member of staff we encountered was professional, polite and helpful. They were genuine and made us feel welcomed.
reviews.title: Great hotel, top class service, brilliant location

reviews.text: Thr rooms were huge compared to what we're used to in Europe. The bed was spacious and comfortable. The decor was stylish but homely. We really enjoyed coming back to the room after long days out exploring the city.
reviews.title: Superb service, fabulous rooms and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the London Hotel in NYC so very much that when it came to planning a special night for someone I adore, I chose the London West Hollywood. The lobby is chic and inviting, and the rooms are glamourous and sultry. The view from our suite of the Los Angeles skyline was spectacular. The terrace of the suite was quiet and romantic and the lights of the city sparkled in the distance. The room service is spot-on with even the best of sparkling wine and champagne at our fingertips. The modern suite feels much more like a luxury apartment in the heart of everything magnificent and memory-making in West Hollywood. The clock near the bed had an iPod attachment, so even my favorite music was easily able to add to the already amazing ambience. The well laid-out room features a perfect couch/sitting aread for casual convesation and special moments. The bathroom was spectacularly appointed with special attention to the details and a dual shower head just in case. Overall this is a lovely, modern hotel which can be greatly appreciated by city dwellers who would like a chic respite for romance or business in the heart of a bustling metropolis. This was my night of romance come true and I hope it is for you as well!!!
reviews.title: Sexy and Sumptuous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stylish hotel with nice-sized room and bathroom, rooftop pool was an extremely welcome break, but ever so slightly pretentious. Location in West Hollywood is excellent for a gay couple on honeymoon! Buffet breakfast was great - and it was highly entertainly listening to the receptionist telling us that the breakfast was 'part of the London experience'.
reviews.title: Excellent - loved it!

reviews.text: Only downer is the valet parking - a rip-off; just park on the the streets in the day and in the parking lot next door for the evening!
reviews.title: The most gorgeous Pool in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a gorgeous hotel! and the pool....simply amazing. but what really stood out to us what the wonderful way we were treated by everyone there. we came to visit some friends who were staying there and had dinner in the restaurant. while we didn't get to actually hang out at the pool, it's reserved for guests only...we did manage to finagle a tour of the rooftop. seeing the skyline of la at night from the roof was a perfect ending to a magical weekend. we definitely will be booking our next vacay at the london!! thank you london...
reviews.title: Biggest rooms in LA

reviews.text: With a king size bed, great sitting area and vast bathroom, including bath and double shower, this is one of the best places to stay in LA. Staff and service excellent, and the rooms even have a wet bar. The roof top pool and bar are great to while away an hour or two, and the car service around town - operating afternoon into evening is a great convenience, Only complaint, no restocking of in room amenities.
reviews.title: Great Staycation at a Swanky Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The London last weekend (August 20 an 21st). We live 45 minutes away from there but stayed over night for the music festival. The hotel was gorgeous, the amenities well appointed. The staff was warm, gracious and very helpful. Although we live locally and don't stay in Hollywood very often, last weekend was a special treat for my husband and I, a birthday weekend. We enjoyed dinner and cocktails on the rooftop. I had the best hamburger I have ever had there! The view was spectacular and the room was spacious, luxurious and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely recommend the hotel for out of town guests. The hotel is not inexpensive, however, well worth the splurge. Special thank you to the staff for sending up complimentary wine and chocolates for my husband's birthday. We had a great time and will be sure to find an "excuse" to stay forty five minutes from our home, at The London Hotel- West Hollywood again!!!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, highly recommend.

reviews.text: S. Doucette
reviews.title: Nice hotel but appalled by treatment at the pool!!!

reviews.text: Stayed during LA leg of our tour of the West Coast (family - 2 adults & teenager). The hotel is lovely, clean & modern with nice big spacious rooms & bathrooms but our stay was completely marred by the treatment at the pool by one of the attendants. On arrival were asked if we had 1 room or 2 when we said 1 we were told we (my husband & I)could have a lounger but not my son as it was 2 loungers per room - ARE YOU SERIOUS?? My son spent a few minutes sitting at the bottom of ours but then went back to the room as he was totally embarrassed. To make matters worse the pool area was fairly empty so there were ample loungers available!! Then to add insult to injury a single man arrived with his dog about 20 minutes later & he got a lounger for him & one for THE DOG!!! UNBELIEVABLE!! After seeing this, I called my son to the room told him to come down & take a lounger however we stayed a short while & didn't visit the pool again for the duration of our stay. When asked on checkout if everything was Ok & I started "well not really..." it was obvious that the clerk didnot want a complaint & swiftly interrupted "I mean't with your bill". In hindsight I should have made more of an issue when it happened or on check out but I'm generally not one to complain & didn't want to further embarass my son at the time. Aside from this incident - which DID ruin the entire stay - check in, valet, bell hop & service staff were very polite. Breakfast was fairly good with a nice choice. Dinner in Gordon Ramsey was quite possibly one of the worst meals I've ever eaten (will review seperately). Valet parking $32/day. Location fairly good but NOT A FAMILY HOTEL & I would not recommend to families. If you are there to be seen then this is the place for you! Stayed in numerous hotels & this is the worst service I have ever encountered which is reflected in my overall rating of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, would definitely come back, good value for money.

reviews.text: Hard to fault, huge rooms, great location, good breakfast, good pool, no need to stay anywhere else in LA
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: There is not actually a lot to be said about this hotel. Flawless service. Flawless food. Comfort. One cannot go wrong staying there. Stayed one week in a two double bed London Crown Suite: clean, modern and spacious. Was it a little pricey? Yes it was, but in this case, one really gets what one pays for.
reviews.title: Beautiful from the inside and up top with service to match

reviews.text: I had a long - almost two week stay at the London and have difficulty faulting the service or amenities offered. The rooms are large and well proportioned with great bathrooms. The London offers free wifi throughout the hotel. The buffet breakfast was very good. The rooftop pool area has great views and service to match.
reviews.title: Just a great hotel...

reviews.text: Overall top marks to the staff and management. I will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. Beautiful, Upscale, Huge Rooms! 4 Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The London is a beautiful boutique style hotel off of Sunset, away from the hustle of the more touristy areas, which made it very nice and relaxing. Super quiet, pretty low-key environment. Stayed in one of their Veranda Suites, the balcony/terrace is about 1/2 the size of the room....HUGE!! Bathroom is amazing, all mosaic tiling, huge double headed rain shower and jacuzzi tub. Room was large and very comfortable, we got room service from the Gordon Ramsay Boxwood Cafe downstairs. Valet is a little pricey @ $30 a day. Wish we had more time in LA, but will definitely be back again....and when we're back, we'll be staying at The London!
reviews.title: Luxury, Location and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a London Sunset Suite and loved every minute of our stay.
reviews.title: Return trip to the London

reviews.text: The rooms are luxurious and the Hotel amenities are the best.
reviews.title: Absolutely terrible experience!

reviews.text: This hotel is my favorite by far in all of Los Angeles. And I haven't vacationed in LA since my 20's. But if I were to again, I'd stay here in a heart beat. The rooms are luxurious with a great big balcony to enjoy breakfast or drink in the sunset on(when the smog doesn't turn the sky brown-gray). Bathroom is sparkling clean and super spacious with a deep sumptuous tub stocked with qualityand generously-sized toiletries and lotion to soak away the stress of the day. You can buy full sized versions of the toiletries in the shop downstairs. They were so good, I wish I had. The stylish sitting area in the suite is large enough to entertain a few people for pre-dinner drinks and bites(more if you open up the sliding doors to the balcony) before heading out for dinner. Or if you want to just cozy up w/ room service, Gordon Ramsey's menu does offer pretty tasty and fresh albeit pricey offerings. The bed is plush and inviting with down duvet after a hard day of working or playing outside. If you don't want to fight the LA gridlock yourself, they have large black SUVs(Escalades? Hummers? Typical gas guzzlers - Los Angeleans never learn) to take you to nearby destinations compliments of the hotel. The drivers were very friendly and down to earth. For the price of a little over $300, I think this hotel is worth its weight in gold for the West Hollywood/Beverly HIlls area.
reviews.title: Lux Hotel with Classy Service

reviews.text: We stayed here for 11 nights in July and overall had a good time check in was quick there were two families in our party and our friends arrived first to be upgraded to a lovely room 706 with triple windows sofa two double beds n huge bathroom then we checked in to be told we had been upgraded too but our room was a standard room one wi Dow and no sofa etc the room was nice but after seeing theirs I was a bit gutted that we had both booked and paid the same mo ey we should have been given the same quality rooms . Breakfast was good for the first two days then it was all the same n we all got fed up of the quiche etc a bit of variation would've been good, we did eat on the roof terrace one night n ordered the burger which had blood streaming out of it so we sent it back to be given the same again so we were not charged for it my husband ordered fish n chips which was two tiny bits of stinking fish and six crisps for 40 dollars cmon Gordon get a grip hence we never ate there again , the pool area was very nice but avoid the cabannas they quote you 250 dollars for a six hour stint but after tax etc the bill was 360 dollars not worth that and we were only allowed two sun loungers between 6 of us as the pool area was busy so basically 4 of us had to sit in the cabanna all day,,, the pool was a magnet for celebrities when we were there Justin beiber , selena gomaz,nicki Clark,and Hugh hefners bunny girls were all staying there n probably lots of others that we didn't recognise. Over all a nice hotel clean throughout. The only let down was really Gordon ram say ,,,,,, oh n very over priced drinks etc
reviews.title: Great hotel but Gordon ram say needs to pull his socks up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I
reviews.title: Good Choice in West Hollywood...some drawbacks
Not Great
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as part of our 3-week honeymoon and this was just the first two nights (with a plan to rest from the wedding, relax and prepare for our Hawaii trip). It it was indeed very nice 3 day stay. Room are very nicely appointed (I wouldn't call them suites tho) with all amenities possible. Loved the toiletries and the softest bed ever. Also, the sheets have a little scent which we liked very much (but some some people might not). The staff is very nice, however one can perceive them a little snobbish at times. The Lobby is nice while corridors get very stuffy over the day (bad ventilation). Also, they tend to have a lot of private events on the roof (where the pool is). As a compensation they offer free cocktails at 5. If you want to use the pool, plan on doing that in the morning. Oh, and their bathrooms aver very very nice and spacious (bathtub for two, double shower, ...lots of towels, bathrobes,) - very good.
Concierge: incompetent. We asked for three different stores and they gave us wrong information all three times (the stores moved or closed more than 6 months ago).
reviews.title: Great location and service

aka: The London West Hollywood Hotel West Hollywood
